channel.title: Posts on norbix.dev - The log of my journey through code & software systems architecture
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on norbix.dev - The log of my journey through code & software systems architecture

item.title: Best Practices for Software Development in Go
item.description: A collection of real-world Go best practices from years of building backend systems, APIs, and cloud-native services.

item.title: Keywords in Software Architecture
item.description: A visual exploration of the core keywords and concepts in modern software architecture.

item.title: Diagrams: Mermaid Syntax Highlights
item.description: A quick reference guide to using Mermaid syntax for creating various types of diagrams, including flowcharts, graphs, and more.

item.title: Breaking the Chain: Dependency Inversion, Interfaces, and Testable Go Code
item.description: A deep dive into the Dependency Inversion Principle, its implementation with interfaces and dependency injection, and how it unlocks clean, testable Go code.

item.title: GoF Design Patterns in Go: Practical Examples
item.description: Explore the 23 Gang of Four (GoF) design patterns in Go with clear explanations and code snippets, grouped into creational, structural, and behavioral categories.

item.title: DSA - Data Structures and Algorithms
item.description: A deep dive into Data Structures and Algorithms (DSA) using Go and its Python counterpart, covering essential concepts, implementations, and best practices.

item.title: Graph Theory Algorithms 4 Competitive Programming
item.description: A comprehensive guide to graph theory algorithms in Go, covering essential concepts, implementations, and best practices for competitive programming.

item.title: Concurrency in Go
item.description: A deep dive into concurrency in Go, covering goroutines, channels, and real-world patterns.

item.title: Demystifying Big-O Notation in Software Engineering
item.description: Understand Big-O notation through real-world Go examples and discover how algorithmic complexity impacts code scalability, performance, and design choices.

item.title: Debugging Go Code: Techniques, Tools, and IDE Support
item.description: Learn effective debugging techniques for Go code using tools like Delve, and how to leverage modern IDEs such as VSCode and IntelliJ IDEA for faster diagnosis and fixes.

item.title: Profiling Go Applications: CPU, Memory, and Concurrency Insights
item.description: Learn how to profile Go applications using pprof, trace, and runtime tools to uncover bottlenecks, memory leaks, and concurrency issues in production and development.

item.title: Extreme Programming (XP): Engineering Excellence on Speed
item.description: What is Extreme Programming (XP)? Explore its core practices, values, and how it helps teams deliver high-quality software with speed, feedback, and sustainability.

item.title: DevOps Deployment
item.description: A comprehensive guide to deploying a 3-tier application using Docker, Kubernetes, and Helm.

item.title: Engineering for Reliability: What SRE Is Really About
item.description: An in-depth look into Site Reliability Engineering (SRE): its core principles, how it’s different from DevOps, and how teams can adopt SRE to build reliable, scalable systems.

item.title: Platform Engineering: The DevOps You Productize
item.description: What is Platform Engineering? How is it different from DevOps or SRE? This article unpacks the role of platform teams, why they’re critical in modern software delivery, and how they bring together cloud, automation, and developer experience.

item.title: Building SaaS Microservices in Go: REST, gRPC, GraphQL, and WebSocket APIs
item.description: Explore how to build SaaS-ready microservices in Go using REST, gRPC, GraphQL, and WebSockets. Learn the trade-offs, use cases, and tooling for each API style.

item.title: Understanding Databases: B-Trees, SQL, NoSQL, ACID, and Normalization
item.description: Learn the key database concepts every software engineer should know: B-Trees, SQL, NoSQL, ACID properties, and database normalization principles.

item.title: Movement Patterns & Logical Thinking in Software Engineering
item.description: Exploring the intersection of movement patterns and logical thinking in software engineering, with a focus on algorithms and design.

item.title: The Generic Protocol Pattern in Go: Designing Extensible CLI Interfaces
item.description: Learn how to implement a flexible and extensible protocol pattern in Go for building structured CLI interfaces and stream-based IPC communication.

item.title: Demystifying Artificial Intelligence: AI, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning
item.description: Understand the difference between Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning. Learn how these concepts fit together and power modern software systems.

item.title: Architectural Patterns in Go: MVC, Hexagonal, CQRS, and Microservices
item.description: Understand the difference between design patterns and architectural patterns. Explore how MVC, Hexagonal, CQRS, and Microservices can be applied in Go projects with practical insights and examples.

item.title: REST vs GraphQL vs WebSocket vs gRPC: API Styles and Contracts in Go
item.description: From REST to GraphQL, WebSocket, and gRPC — explore API communication patterns and how contracts like OpenAPI, Swagger, and Protobuf shape modern Go systems.

item.title: Concurrency in Python
item.description: Learn how Python handles concurrency and parallelism using threads, processes, and async with asyncio.

item.title: Humble Consulting: How Curiosity Creates Real Business Value
item.description: Exploring Edgar H. Schein’s idea of Humble Consulting and how curiosity, empathy, and co-creation lead to measurable business value—earning more, saving more, and reaching hidden gatekeepers.
